pageContext.name: inspiration ENG
pageContext.prefixed:
<tei-TEI data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="TEI" data-origatts="xmlns">

  <tei-teiHeader data-origname="teiHeader">
      <tei-fileDesc data-origname="fileDesc">
         <tei-titleStmt data-origname="titleStmt">
            <tei-title data-origname="title">An Account of a Voyage up the River de la Plata, and thence over land to Peru</tei-title>
            <tei-author data-origname="author">Mons. Acarete du Bifcay</tei-author>
            <tei-editor data-origname="editor">Helados Group</tei-editor>

         </tei-titleStmt>
         <tei-publicationStmt data-origname="publicationStmt">
            <tei-p data-origname="p">
            <tei-ref target="https://www.loc.gov/resource/rbc0001.2019gen17198/?sp=6&r=-0.742,0.387,2.483,0.918,0" data-origname="ref" data-origatts="target">
      
            </tei-ref>
            </tei-p>
         </tei-publicationStmt>
         <tei-sourceDesc data-origname="sourceDesc">
         <tei-bibl data-origname="bibl">
         <tei-pubPlace data-origname="pubPlace">London</tei-pubPlace>
         <tei-publisher data-origname="publisher"> Printed for S. Bucklet </tei-publisher>
         <tei-date data-origname="date"> 1698 </tei-date>
         <tei-add data-origname="add"> With Observations on the Inhabitants, as well Indians and Spainards, the Cities, Commerce, Fertility, and Riches of that Part of America. </tei-add>   
         </tei-bibl>
         </tei-sourceDesc>
      </tei-fileDesc>
  </tei-teiHeader>
  <tei-text data-origname="text">
      <tei-body data-origname="body">
          <tei-head data-origname="head">A Description of the City of Potosi, and the Mines there</tei-head>

         <tei-figure xml:id="englishpage" id="englishpage" data-origname="figure" data-origatts="xml:id"> <tei-graphic url="acarete.eng.42.jpg" data-origname="graphic" data-origatts="url" data-empty=""/> </tei-figure> 
         <tei-div type="chapter" xml:lang="en" lang="en" data-origname="div" data-origatts="xml:lang type">
            
         <tei-pb n="42" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
         

         <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">42 A Voyage to Peru</tei-fw>
              <tei-p xml:id="textindent" id="textindent" data-origname="p" data-origatts="xml:id"> 
                 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-c data-origname="c">I</tei-c> was no sooner alighted from my <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Horse, at a Merchants House to <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>whom I had been recommended, but I <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>was conducted by him to the, <tei-name type="personRoleName" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">President</tei-name> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of the Provinces of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Los Charcas</tei-name>, to <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>whom the Order I carried from the King <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of <tei-name type="country" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Spain</tei-name> was directed, as the Principal <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Director of his <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-sic data-origname="sic">Catholick</tei-sic><tei-corr data-origname="corr">Catholic</tei-corr></tei-choice> Majesty's Af<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>fairs in this Province, in which <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Potosi</tei-name> is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Situate, which is the place of his Ordi<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>nary Residence, <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">altho'</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">although</tei-reg></tei-choice> the <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">City de la <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Plata</tei-name> is the Capital. After I had <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">deli<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ver'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">delivered</tei-reg></tei-choice> the Order to him, I was brought <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>to the <tei-name type="personRoleName" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Corregidor</tei-name>, to deliver that which  <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>belong'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">belonged</tei-reg></tei-choice> to him, and afterwards to thofe <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>other Officers for whom I brought Or<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ders; they all <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">receiv'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">received</tei-reg></tei-choice> me very well, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>particularly the <tei-name type="personRoleName" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">President</tei-name>, who present<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ed me with a Chain of Gold for the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>good News I had brought <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-sic data-origname="sic">himn</tei-sic> <tei-corr data-origname="corr">him</tei-corr></tei-choice>.</tei-p> 
              <tei-p xml:id="bottom" id="bottom" data-origname="p" data-origatts="xml:id">
                 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>But before we go any farther <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">'tis</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">this</tei-reg></tei-choice> con<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>venient I should give some description <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of the City of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Potosi</tei-name>, as I have done of </tei-p>
                 
         <tei-fw type="catch" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">others.</tei-fw> 


         <tei-pb n="43" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
         <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">up the R. de la Plata 43</tei-fw>
              <tei-p xml:id="bottomline" id="bottomline" data-origname="p" data-origatts="xml:id"> 
                 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>others. The <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Spaniards</tei-rs> call it the <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Impe<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>rial City</tei-name>, but no body could ever tell <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>me for what reason; <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">'tis</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">this</tei-reg></tei-choice> Situate at the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Foot of a Mountain,  <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">call'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">called</tei-reg></tei-choice> <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Arazassou</tei-name>, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and divided: in the midst by a River, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>which comes from a Lake <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">inclos'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">inclosed</tei-reg></tei-choice> with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Walls, which lies about a quarter a <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>League above the City, and is a kind of <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>reserver to hold the Water that is neces<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>sary for the Work-houses of that part <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of the City, which is on this side ot the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>River, over against the Mountain, is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">rais'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">raised</tei-reg> </tei-choice> upon a little Hill, and is the larg<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>est and most inhabited part; for on <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>that which is on the side of the Moun<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tain, there's scarce any thing but Engines <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and the Houses of those that Work in <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>'em. The City has neither Walls, Ditch<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>es, nor Forts for its defence, there are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>reckon'd to be 4000 Houses well built <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of good Stone, with several Floors, af<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ter the manner of the Buildings in <tei-name type="country" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Spain</tei-name>. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>The Churches are well made, and all <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>richly <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">adorn'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">adorned</tei-reg></tei-choice> with Plate, Tapestry, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and other Ornaments, and above all <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>those of the Monks and Nunns, of <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>whom there are several Convents of <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>different Orders, which are very well <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">furnish'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">furnished</tei-reg></tei-choice>. This is not the least populous <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>City of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Peru</tei-name>, with <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Spaniards</tei-rs>, <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Mestices</tei-rs>,</tei-p> 
                 
         <tei-fw type="catch" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">Stran-</tei-fw> 


         <tei-pb n="44" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
         <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">44 A Voyage to Peru</tei-fw>
             <tei-p xml:id="bottomline" id="bottomline" data-origname="p" data-origatts="xml:id"> 
                <tei-rs data-origname="rs"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Strangers</tei-rs>, and <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Natives</tei-rs> (which last the <tei-rs data-origname="rs"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Spaniards</tei-rs> call <tei-foreign data-origname="foreign">Indios</tei-foreign>) with <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Moulatos</tei-rs> and <tei-rs data-origname="rs"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Negroes</tei-rs>. They count there are between <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>3 and 4000 Natural <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Spaniards</tei-rs> bear<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ing Arms, who have the Reputation of <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>being very stout Men and good Souldi<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ers, The number of the <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Mestices</tei-rs> is not <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>much less, nor are they less expert at a <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Weapon, but the greatest part of 'em, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>are Idle, apt to quarrel and Treache<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>rous, therefore they commonly wear <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Three or Four Buff-wast-coats one upon <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>another, which are proof against the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>point of a Sword, to secure themselves <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>from private stabs. The <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Strangers</tei-rs> there <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>are but few, there are some <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Dutch</tei-rs>, <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Irist</tei-rs>, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Genoese</tei-rs>; and some <tei-rs data-origname="rs">French</tei-rs>, most of <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>whom are of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">St. Malo</tei-name>, <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Provence</tei-name> or <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Bay<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>onne</tei-name>, and pass for People of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Navarre</tei-name> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Biscaye</tei-name>. As for the <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Indians</tei-rs> they are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">reckon'd</tei-orig><tei-reg data-origname="reg">reckoned</tei-reg></tei-choice> to amount to near 10000 be<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>sides the <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Moulatos</tei-rs> and the <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Blacks</tei-rs>: but <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>they are not permitted to wear either <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Swords or Fire-Arms, no not their <tei-name type="personRoleName" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Cou<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>racas</tei-name> and <tei-name type="personRoleName" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Caciques</tei-name>, <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">tho'</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">though</tei-reg></tei-choice> they may all <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>aspire to any degree of Knight-hood, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and to Benefices, to which they are of<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ten <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">rais'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">raised</tei-reg></tei-choice>, for their laudable Actions, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and good Services. They are also for<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>bidden to wear the Spanish habit, but </tei-p>
                
         <tei-fw type="catch" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">are</tei-fw> 


         <tei-pb n="45" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
         <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type"> up the R. de la Plata 45</tei-fw>
             <tei-p xml:id="bottomline" id="bottomline" data-origname="p" data-origatts="xml:id"> 
                <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>are <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">oblig'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">obliged</tei-reg></tei-choice> to cloath themselves in a dif<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ferent manner, in a close-coat without <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>sleeves, which they wear next their Shirts, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>to which their Band and <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">lac'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">laced</tei-reg></tei-choice> Cuffs are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">fasten'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">fastened</tei-reg></tei-choice>, their Breeches are wide at bot<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tom after the French fashion; their Legs <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and Feet naked. The <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Blacks</tei-rs> and <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Mou<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>latos</tei-rs> being in the Service of the <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Spa<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>niards</tei-rs>, are habited after the Spanish <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Mode, and may bear Arms, and all the <tei-rs data-origname="rs"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Indian Slaves</tei-rs> after Ten Years service are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>set at liberty, and have the same privi<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>leges with the others. The Government <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of this City is very exact, by the Care <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>which is taken by Twenty four Magi<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>strates, who are constantly observing, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>that good orders be kept in it; besides <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>the <tei-name type="personalRoleName" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Corregidor</tei-name> and <tei-name type="personalRoleName" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">President</tei-name> of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Los Char<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>cas</tei-name>, who directs Officers after the man<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ner of <tei-name type="country" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Spain</tei-name>. It is to be <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">observ'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">observed</tei-reg></tei-choice>, that <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>excepting these two Principal Officers, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>as well at <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Potosi</tei-name> as every where else in <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>the <tei-rs data-origname="rs">Indies</tei-rs>, all the People, whether <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Knights, Gentlemen, Officers or others, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>are <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">concern'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">concerned</tei-reg></tei-choice> in Commerce; of which <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>some of them make so great an advan<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tage, that in the City of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Potosi</tei-name>, there <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>are some <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">reckon'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">reckoned</tei-reg></tei-choice> to be worth. Two, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>some Three, and some Four Millions of <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Crowns; and a great many worth Two,  </tei-p>
                
         <tei-fw type="catch" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">Three,</tei-fw>


         <tei-pb n="46" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
         <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">46 A Voyage to Peru</tei-fw>
             <tei-p xml:id="bottomline" id="bottomline" data-origname="p" data-origatts="xml:id"> 
                <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Three or Four hundred thousand <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Crowns. The common People to live <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>much at their ease, but are all proud and fine, either <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>haughty, and always go very <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>in Cloth of Gold and Silver, or in Scar<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>let, or Silk trimmed with a great deal <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of Gold and Silver-Lace. The Furni<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ture of their Houses is very Rich, for <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>they are generally <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">serv'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">served</tei-reg></tei-choice> in Plate. The <tei-rs data-origname="rs"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Wives</tei-rs> both of Gentlemen and Citi<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>zens, are kept very close, to a degree <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>beyond what they are in <tei-name type="country" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Spain</tei-name>; they ne<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>ver go abroad, unless it be to go to <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Mass, or to make some Visit, or to some <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-sic data-origname="sic">publick</tei-sic> <tei-corr data-origname="corr">public</tei-corr></tei-choice> Feast; and that but rarely. The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Women here are generally addicted to <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>excess in taking <tei-foreign data-origname="foreign">Coca</tei-foreign>: This is a Plant <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>that comes from the side of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Cusco</tei-name> which <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>when it is made up in Rowls and <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">dry'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">dried</tei-reg></tei-choice> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>they chew, as some do Tobacco; they <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>are so heated, and sometimes absolutely <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>fuddled by it, that they have no com<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>mand of themselves at all: <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">'Tis</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">This</tei-reg></tei-choice> likewise <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>often <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">us'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">used</tei-reg></tei-choice> by the Men, and has the same <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>effects upon them. They are otherwise <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>very Temperate in eating and drinking, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">tho'</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">though</tei-reg></tei-choice> they have before dwelt in places <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>well <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">stor'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">stored</tei-reg></tei-choice> with all sort of Provisions, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>as Beef, Mutton, Fowls, Venizon, raw <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">preserv'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">preserved</tei-reg></tei-choice> Fruits, Corn and Wine,</tei-p> 
                
         <tei-fw type="catch" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">which</tei-fw> 


         <tei-pb n="47" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/> 
         <tei-fw type="head" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type"> up the R. de la Plata 47</tei-fw>
             <tei-p data-origname="p"> 
                <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>which are brought hither from other <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>parts, and some from a great distance, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>which makes these Commodities dear, so <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>that the meaner sort of People; especially <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>those that have very little before-hand, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>would find it hard enough to live there, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>if Money were not very plenty, and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>easie to be got by them that are willing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>to work.</tei-p>

             <tei-p xml:id="bottom" id="bottom" data-origname="p" data-origatts="xml:id">
                <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>The best and finest Silver in all the <tei-name type="country" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">In<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>dies</tei-name>, is that of the Mines of <tei-name type="place" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Potosi</tei-name>, the prin<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>cipal of which are found in the Mountain <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of <tei-name type="placeGeog" data-origname="name" data-origatts="type">Aranzasse</tei-name>, where besides the prodigious <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>quantities of Silver that have been taken <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>out of Veins, in which the Mettal evi<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>dently <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">appear'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">appeared</tei-reg></tei-choice>, and which are now <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>exhausted, there is almost as great quan<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tities of it found in places where they <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>had not <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">digg'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">dug</tei-reg></tei-choice> before; nay from some <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>of the Earth which they threw aside for<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>merly when they <tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">open'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">opened</tei-reg></tei-choice> the Mines and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>made Pits, and Cross-ways in the Moun<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>tains, they have taken Silver, and have <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>found by this, that the Silver has been <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/><tei-choice data-origname="choice"><tei-orig data-origname="orig">form'd</tei-orig> <tei-reg data-origname="reg">formed</tei-reg></tei-choice> since that time, which shews how <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>proper the Quality of this Ground is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>for the production of that Metal: But <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>indeed this Earth does not vield so much <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>as the Mines that are found by Veins a<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>mong the Rocks.</tei-p> 

</tei-div>
      </tei-body>
  </tei-text>
</tei-TEI>
